page.title: 14CHURCHES AROUND S.E.DEWSBURY
page.content: There are 5 buildings of the Church of England,1 Catholic,11 non-conformist,3 mosques and 5 buildings of other denominations.Attendance at most churches has declined,particularly near the town centre, because of re- location of the white popultion to surrounding areas. Town centre housing now occupied by Asian people explains the establishment of 3 mosques including one of Europe's largest. Most churches have reduced the number of Sunday services,and some buildings are no longer served by their own vicar or priest, but share a clergyman with a number of others.Two churches of different denominations sometimes share the same buildings for their services.Many churches provide leisure time activities through various organisations such as Scouts, Guides, men's and women's societies.
